topics.body:
Speaking of anime-
*random thought*
You know what I would like to see?  Western cgi anime?
*dodges bullet*


What I mean by this is that there have been some major attempts at bringing anime to the west but for the most part they've failed because they try to hard pretend to be something it's not.  It's like trying to watch someone with a southern USA accent and that's Caucasian trying to fool us into making us believe they're from Japan.  Avatar and Legend of Korra are damn good shows cause they know rather than be something they're not they focus on being good instead.

CGI anime holds potential cause it's cheaper.  I have seen good cgi anime before, but the problem that the west has and a lot of companies have is they try to force it into a animation show; if you put cgi in a animated show it's going to be obvious and it's going to look fucking hideous.  If you made a entirely cgi anime it would look better than if you had a cgi/animated show.  RWBY may not be the super best looking but considering that it's being made by a very small company it's pretty damn impressive.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ed2ff86368721e3e0a0200#post_53ed2ff86368721e3e0a0200
You do realize "anime" is just the equivalent of "cartoon" right?  That's like the people that get upset saying that teˈmɑːtau(one way to pronounce tomato) isn't the same thing as teˈmeitou(the other way to pronounce tomato).  Just cause you pronounce it differently doesn't mean it's a different fruit all of a sudden.

I feel like you two are trying to put words into my mouth. And I hate it.

topics.body:
Anyways I think we've lost track of what I was saying:
I'd hate to use advent children as a analogy for what I was talking about, but you have to admit for a cgi movie that the style for the characters is based off anime style you do have to admit though that it looked pretty decent.

CGI that is based off anime can look good if done by someone that knows what they're doing.
